title.narrative: Rural Education and Development (READ) Project (formerly Rural Education Support Project)

description.narrative: The Mongolia Rural Education and Development (Read) Project aims to help enhance education quality in rural primary school grades 1-5. There are three project components. Component 1 aims to support rural schools by increasing the amount of learning materials available to students and teachers while supporting teachers and their school networks in the use of learning materials. Component 1 establishes classroom libraries and promotes reading through professional development, professional teacher networks, and a public reading campaign. Component 2 strives to strengthen the government's capacity to monitor student learning through participation in national and international assessments. It strengthens national assessment and improves the efficiency of education policy tools. Component 3 provides financial and technical support for project management and monitoring of the project.

condition.narrative: An independent audit firm, acceptable to IDA, to undertake audits of project accounts, will be appointed by December 31, 2006.
Implementation of the project will be carried out in a manner consistent with the Berne Convention on copyright protection towhichM ongolia is a signatory.
Maintenance of the PMU under terms of reference acceptable to IDA; the PMU will maintain adequate facilities and staff and belocate d in the MECS complex during the life of the project.
The Recipient should have its financial statement audited and furnish the report to the Bank not later than six months after theend of one fiscal year after the recipient.

These figures aggregate: 2,000 students in TIMSS pilot for YR1, 9,000 students in TIMSS and 1,000 students in grade-5assessment pilot in YR2, and 4,500 students in grade-5 assessments in YR3.

title.narrative: System for learning assessment at the primary level

comment.narrative: Mongolia currently has a national examination at end of basic education. However, every school set its own examination. MECS iscurrently considering reforming this system in light of its Cambridge curricular reform.
EEC has developed national primary assessment tool and started conducting assessments as a pilot.

title.narrative: Students from nationally representative sample of schools participate in National Assessment of Student Progress for Mongolian language and Mathematics and TIMSS.

comment.narrative: Mongolian students had not participated in TIMSS before the project.
Determined from M&E surveys of original READ and of additional financing. Target met since 2007 when 4,500 students participatedin the assessment.
